item.title: South Indian Hindu legal authorities of the middle period
item.description: Source: here. 700 CE bAlakrIDA a commentary on the yAGNYavAlkya smR^iti was composed by vishvarUpa in Shringagiri in Karnataka. ?700 CE bhAruchi wrote commentaries on the viShNu dharmashastra and the manusmR^iti. 1120 CE mitAksharA was written by viGNYAneshvara who was the prime minister of the chAlukya king vikramAditya-04. It was a definitive work on Hindu law that gained currency throughout much of India and continues to be authoritative to this date.
